publications.title: Generation and heterozygous repair of human iPSC lines from three individuals with cerebellar ataxia, neuropathy and vestibular areflexia syndrome (CANVAS) carrying biallelic AAGGG expansions in RFC1

donor.disease_description: Biallelic AAGGG repeat expansions in RFC1
donor.disease_name: Cerebellar ataxia, neuropathy, and vestibular areflexia syndrome (CANVAS)

genomic_modifications.description: Homozygous AAGGG repeat expansion in intron 2 of RFC1

genomic_characterisation.summary: SNP array (0.5 Mb resolution) indicated a normal female karyotype (46,XX) with no aneuploidies or large deletions/insertions detected.

induced_derivation.non_int_vector_name: pEP4 E02S ET2K (Addgene plasmid #20927); pEP4 E02S EN2L (Addgene plasmid #20922); pEP4 E02S EM2K (Addgene plasmid #20923); pSimple-miR302/367 (Addgene plasmid #98748)

ethics.institutional_HREC: Human Research Ethics Committee, The Royal Children's Hospital, Victoria, Australia
